name: Double digits in an array of strings
instruction:
The function `doubleNumbers` takes an array of strings.

Return an array in which all the numbers in the strings are multiplied by 2. If the element is not a number, leave it as it is.

Multiply the numbers from 0 to 9.

Fix the errors in the code to make it work correctly.

There are no errors in the loop. Analyze the code and try to repeat.

Example function call:
```javascript
doubleNumbers(["hello", "hello 123", "0234"]) // ["hello", "hello 246", "0468"]
```
